intro: Citrus medica subf. aurea, commonly known as the citron. It is a citrus fruit characterized by its thick, aromatic rind and a sweet, slightly acidic pulp. The plant is typically a small tree or shrub with smooth, dark green leaves. It produces fruits that are often used in traditional medicine and culinary practices. The botanical features of this subsp. include its ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
